_accidents.OtherReleaseSource: Process vessel relief valve lift and reseat

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
1  EXECUTIVE SUMMARY

1.1  Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies

The 6th Street Cooling, LLC (6th Street Cooling) Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies are simply not to have accidental releases or emergencies.  The Company endeavors to execute this policy through the daily implementation of its Safety Programs.  The safety programs include, but are not limited to a comprehensive Process Safety Management Program (PSM).  The PSM Program is an integrated approach to the safe operation of processes using Regulated Substances, and forms the Program Level III Prevention Program component of the RMP.  The 6th Street Cooling, LLC PSM Program is specifically designed and intended to prevent accidental releases, and to deal safely with emergencies if and when they do happen.  It is the primary goal of 6th Street Cooling, LLC to protect its employees, visitors and neighbors from harm due to Company operations.  With this in mind, the priorities of protection of life, the environment, and then property have been established.  Only when these goals have been achieved may the focus shift to resumption of business operations.
 
6th Street Cooling, LLC has adopted a ?non-responding facility? policy.  A Hazardous Material Business Plan (including Emergency Action Plan element) has been developed and submitted to the ?Designated Agency? (Imperial County Health Department, Division of Environmental Health) with a copy provided to the Holtville Fire Department.  The Business Plan includes the Hazardous Material Inventory consistent with EPCRA compliance in California, and the information necessary to be included in the Area Emergency Plan.  An Emergency Coordinator has been established. Emergency response pre-planning is coordinated and kept current through the annual submission of appropriate reports.  The Fire Department has been contacted to make periodic tours of the facility.  Local response capabilities have been verified.  

6th

Street Cooling, LLC policy also includes maintaining appropriate emergency capabilities and to deal with emergencies safely if and when they do happen.  Key employees attend 1910.120(q) Emergency Response training that is refreshed annually.  These personnel are intended to support the Local Fire Department in the event of an emergency.  Emergency equipment is maintained on-site. 

1.2  General Description of the Stationary Source and Regulated Substances

6th Street Cooling, LLC is a California Limited Liability (LLC) Company made up of Western Precooling Systems ? 50% and Saikhon Family LLC ? 50%.  The 6th Street Cooling, LLC is responsible for operations at the site.

6th Street Cooling, LLC is a refrigeration plant located in Holtville, CA.  The facility provides refrigeration effect for the removal of field heat from freshly harvested produce; and subsequent short-term refrigerated storage.  The Plant is seasonally operated.  Product harvest periods normally begin in early November and end around the end of June.  The Plant refrigeration system is supported with portable refrigeration equipment during peak periods.  General maintenance is year-round, with major maintenance occurring in the off-season summer months.

The Regulated Substance in use is anhydrous ammonia (NH3).  Refrigeration equipment consists of Pressure Vessels, HydroVac? Vacuum Tubes, Refrigeration Trailers (Compressor Units), Ice-making equipment, Pressure Cooling Equipment, Cold Storage Room Evaporators and associated valves, instrumentation and piping.  The vacuum tubes are used to pre-cool agricultural product; the refrigerated storage portion of the facility is used for short-term product storage.  Evaporators in the storage section of the facility maintain temperature until product is sold and shipped.  The refrigeration system is configured in a closed-loop system with isolation and overpressure relief valves installed in key areas.   An ammonia-water diffusion system protects against a

ccidental releases from High-Side Pressure Relief Valves.

6th Street Cooling, LLC is supported by an affiliate company, Western Precooling Systems (WPS).  WPS is a statewide and well-known provider of ammonia refrigeration equipment and maintenance services.  WPS supports 6th Street Cooling, LLC from its? Yuma Operations Office.  Key WPS employees are 1910.120(q) trained and are an additional resource in the event of an emergency.  
 
1.3  General Accidental Release Prevention Program and Chemical Specific Prevention Steps

Accidental Release Prevention Program

A comprehensive Process Safety Management Program (PSM) has been established in accordance with CCR 8, 5189.  The PSM Program is specifically intended to promote the safe operation of ammonia-handling equipment and process, and to prevent accidental releases.  6th Street Cooling, LLC strives to make the PSM Program an integral part of daily Plant operation.  Other safety programs are also integrated with the PSM Program, to the extent practicable and appropriate.

Chemical-Specific Prevention Steps

?Entrance to the facility is closely monitored.  
?The facility is enclosed with fencing and gates.
?Employees are trained for hazard communication (discovery and communicating) for releases, fires, vandals, etc.  Training is documented in each employees training record file.
?Only qualified personnel perform work on the process.  
?Self-closing valves have been installed for process oil draining
?Diffusion systems prevent accidental ?High Side? Pressure Relief Valve lifts from releasing directly to the atmosphere  
?6th Street Cooling, LLC proactively trains its personnel in the benefits of good housekeeping.  There is a staff to maintain the general appearance of the facility on a day-to-day basis.

1.4  Summary of the Five-Year Accident History
